issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description: Is it possible to detect (ie through an event listener) when a user has closed a video that is playing in the standard OS video player. I have been mainly using iPhone up to date but also interested in Android. The motivation for this question is that I want to be able to set the window to portrait AND/OR landscape orientation modes when I play a video (for the best play experience in landscape mode) and set back to portrait (which the rest of my app uses) when the user has finished with the video. See the Close button in the attached screen grab for iPhone playing a video.
fields.summary: Video close event in standard mobile OS video player?

comments.body:
Simon

This really isn't the place for questions. Please open a thread in the [Q&A|http://developer.appcelerator.com/questions/created].

Please read  [Submitting Bug Reports|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-SubmittingBugReports] before raising any more tickets.

Thank you
